clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Hearing Preservation in Adults With Partial Low-Frequency Hearing Implanted With the HiFocus™ Mid-Scala Electrode
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Hearing Preservation in Adults With Partial Low-Frequency Hearing Implanted With the HiFocus™ Mid-Scala Electrode

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the feasibility of preserving low-frequency acoustic hearing in adults with a moderate degree of hearing loss in the low frequencies and severe-to-profound hearing loss in the mid-to-high frequencies who are implanted with the HiRes™ 90K Advantage implant with HiFocus™ Mid-Scala electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Low-frequency unaided acoustic hearing thresholds pre and post implantation with the HiFocus™ Mid-Scala electrode array
primary_outcome.description: Unaided low-frequency acoustic hearing thresholds (under earphones) in the implanted ear one month after device activation will be compared to baseline (pre-implant) thresholds in the same ear for audiometric frequencies 125-1000Hz. Threshold changes from baseline will be calculated as: Complete preservation of hearing: threshold shift ≤ 15 dB Partial preservation of hearing: threshold shift ≥ 16 dB with measurable thresholds No preservation of hearing: no measurable thresholds at ≤ 80 dB HL

secondary_outcome.measure: Word recognition in quiet pre and post implantation with the HiFocus™ Mid-Scala electrode array
secondary_outcome.description: Word recognition scores in quiet in the implanted ear one month after device activation compared to pre-implant score with a hearing aid

arm_group.description: HiRes90K™ Advantage implant with HiFocus™ Mid-Scala electrode will be implanted in adults with a moderate level of hearing loss in the low frequencies and severe-to-profound hearing loss in the mid-to-high frequencies.

intervention.intervention_name: HiRes™ 90K Advantage implant with HiFocus™ Mid-Scala electrode

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No previous cochlear implant experience
- 18 years of age or older
- Up to a moderate sensorineural hearing loss in the low-to-mid frequencies (pure tone average ≤ 65 dB HL for 125, 250, 500, and 1000 Hz) and a severe-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss in the high frequencies (pure tone average ≥ 70 dB HL for 2,000, 4,000, and 8,000 Hz) in the ear to be implanted
- Aided monosyllabic word score of 10-50% in the ear to be implanted
- Up to a moderate sensorineural hearing loss in the low-to-mid frequencies (pure tone average ≤ 65 dB HL for 125, 250, 500, and 1000 Hz) and a severe-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss in the high frequencies (pure tone average ≥ 70 dB HL for 2,000, 4,000, and 8,000 Hz) in the contralateral (non-implanted) ear
- English language proficiency
- Willingness to participate in all scheduled procedures outlined in the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous inner ear surgery
- Cochlear malformation or obstruction that would preclude full insertion of electrode array
- Presence of additional disabilities that would prevent or interfere with participation in the required study procedures
- Medical or psychological conditions that contraindicate surgery or impact the ability to manage an implanted device or the study-related procedures
- Evidence of central auditory lesion or compromised auditory nerve
